title: IEA: Global power demand to jump 4.5% as renewables remain ‘largely immune’ to COVID-19 impacts
lead: ​Global demand for electricity is predicted to rise by 4.5% in 2021 – equivalent to 1,000TWh – following heavy reductions as a result of COVID-19.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Ofgem gives green light to half-hourly settlement in retail electricity market
lead: ​Ofgem has given the green light to rolling out half-hourly settlement across the retail electricity market in Britain.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: SMS to rollout green tech across 100 homes in Aberdeen City Council partnership
lead: ​SMS is to rollout solar PV, battery storage and heat pumps across 100 homes as part of a new £5.2 million project.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Government warned not to 'over-regulate' EV transition or risk stifling innovation
lead: ​Whilst a mix of government and private funding is required to fuel transport decarbonisation, policymakers should be careful not to over-regulate.
author: Alice Grundy

title: UK government commits to 78% emissions reduction by 2035
lead: ​The UK has now set in law the Climate Change Committee’s recommendation of a 78% emissions reduction by 2035.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Smart meter installations rebound with 34% month-on-month increase
lead: ​Smart meter installations have jumped 34% month-on-month according to ElectraLink, with 219,000 installations recorded in March 2021.
author: Alice Grundy

title: SET Ventures leads ESFORIN funding round in support of international expansion
lead: ​SET Ventures has led a funding round into European flexible solutions provider ESFORIN SE, with sonnen founder Christoph Ostermann also participating.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Green Alliance: UK will 'struggle' to meet 2050 net zero without ramping up of policy
lead: Green Alliance’s latest net zero policy tracker shows the UK “risks complacency” as it finds emissions will be nearly 40% higher in 2030 than needed to hit decarbonisation targets.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Octopus Energy reveals plans to expand into green hydrogen
lead: ​The Octopus Energy Group is set to expand into the green hydrogen sector, touting the benefits of the technology for "parts of the economy electrification can’t reach".
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Current± Chats: UPS’s Claire Thompson-Sage on grid constraints and fleet transition
lead: Current± caught up with Claire Thompson-Sage, sustainable development co-ordinator at UPS to discuss the EFLES project, the need for flexibility and what’s next in their vehicle decarbonisation journey.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: UKPN trial shows potential to bypass traditional network upgrades for thousands of EV connections
lead: ​UK Power Networks (UKPN) has found that over 500 electric vehicle (EV) chargers could be connected around a single electricity substation using state-of-the-art technology over building new cables or substations.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Modo Energy raises £1m to ‘push boundaries of innovation’
lead: ​Modo Energy has raised over £1 million in investment to help it scale up its energy data analytics software.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Energy UK details 'clear opposition' for mandating use of smart meters for smart EV charging
lead: Mandating the Smart Data Communications Company (DCC) as the enduring solution for smart charging is “not the way to go” according to a new Energy UK report.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Logan Energy expands board as it looks to grow in green hydrogen sector
lead: ​Logan Energy has appointed three new members to its board as it targets green hydrogen expansion.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: UK deemed one of the most expensive countries in Europe for EV charging
lead: ​The UK is the seventh most expensive country to charge an electric vehicle (EV) in Europe, according to new research from Irish price comparison website Switcher.ie.
author: Alice Grundy

title: How flexibility can enable a 100% renewable energy future
lead: While progress has undoubtedly been made in decarbonising the energy sector, more is needed, and fast if we are to meet the Paris Agreement goal writes Jukka Lehtonen, vice president at Wärtsilä Energy.
author: Jukka Lehtonen

title: GB electricity demand resurged in Q1 as low wind drove tight margin trend
lead: ​Electricity demand in Great Britain returned to pre-COVID-19 levels in Q1 2021, with tight margins being a common feature of the quarter.
author: Alice Grundy

title: EO Charging bags Amazon EV deal for over 800 chargers
lead: ​EO Charging has secured a deal with Amazon to install electric vehicle (EV) chargers in support of its fleet electrification, with over 800 rolled out so far. ​
author: Alice Grundy

title: Iduna to crowdfund installation of 50 Greater Manchester EV chargers
lead: ​Electric vehicle (EV) charging firm Iduna is looking to raise £4 million through ethical crowdfunding platform Abundance.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Energising the UK’s net-zero future: How the West Midlands is storing opportunities for energy investment
lead: Energy storage could unlock the UK’s net-zero ambitions, but where do the opportunities for investment lie? Adam Titchen, industry lead at the West Midlands Growth Company outlines what the West Midlands has in store for the sector.
author: Adam Titchen
